Operation 'DuplicatePreBuiltDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary is generic and doesn't indicate the optional naming capability. Description is verbose and contains redundant information ('like duplicating existing designs'). Improved version clarifies the optional request body, automatic naming behavior, customization option, and explicitly states the return value (newly created design object) for better AI agent understanding of what this operation accomplishes and what to expect.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to duplicate one of the pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs**.

Like duplicating one of your existing designs, you are not required to pass any data in the body of a request to this endpoint. If you choose to leave the `name` field blank, your duplicate will be assigned the name of the design it was copied from with the text "Duplicate: " prepended to it. This name change is only a convenience, as the duplicate design will be assigned a unique ID that differentiates it from your other designs. You can retrieve the IDs for Twilio SendGrid pre-built designs using the "List SendGrid Pre-built Designs" endpoint.

You can modify your duplicate's name at the time of creation by passing an updated value to the `name` field when making the initial request.
More on retrieving design IDs can be found above.
data.summary_suggestion: Duplicate a pre-built design with optional name
data.description_suggestion: Creates a copy of a pre-built design from the Twilio SendGrid library. The request body is optional. If the `name` field is omitted, the duplicate will be automatically named with the original design name prefixed by "Duplicate: ". You can customize the duplicate's name by providing a `name` value in the request body. The duplicated design is assigned a unique ID and stored in your Design Library. Returns the newly created design object with its unique ID and specified or auto-generated name.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic and doesn't indicate the optional naming capability. Description is verbose and contains redundant information ('like duplicating existing designs'). Improved version clarifies the optional request body, automatic naming behavior, customization option, and explicitly states the return value (newly created design object) for better AI agent understanding of what this operation accomplishes and what to expect.

message: Operation 'GetPreBuiltDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary lacks specificity about the ID parameter requirement. Description is repetitive and vague about what 'details' are returned. Improved version specifies the ID parameter requirement, clarifies the return value structure (complete design object with metadata, editor type, content), and provides clearer context about the operation's role in the design workflow for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single pre-built design**.

A GET request to `/designs/pre-builts/{id}` will retrieve details about a specific pre-built design.

This endpoint is valuable when retrieving details about a pre-built design that you wish to duplicate and modify.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a pre-built design by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific pre-built design from the Twilio SendGrid library using its unique ID. Returns the complete design object including metadata, editor type, and design content. This operation is useful for reviewing pre-built design details before duplicating and customizing them for your campaigns.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks specificity about the ID parameter requirement. Description is repetitive and vague about what 'details' are returned. Improved version specifies the ID parameter requirement, clarifies the return value structure (complete design object with metadata, editor type, content), and provides clearer context about the operation's role in the design workflow for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ListDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'List Designs' is too generic and doesn't distinguish this endpoint from ListPreBuiltDesign. Description lacks clarity about the response structure and return type. Added distinction between user designs and pre-built designs, clarified pagination behavior, and specified the response format (array of DesignOutputSummary objects) to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of designs already stored in your Design Library**.

A GET request to `/designs` will return a list of your existing designs. This endpoint will not return the pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs. Pre-built designs can be retrieved using the `/designs/pre-builts` endpoint, which is detailed below.

By default, you will receive 100 results per request; however, you can modify the number of results returned by passing an integer to the `page_size` query parameter.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of designs stored in your Design Library. Returns only user-created designs, excluding pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs (use `/designs/pre-builts` for those). Supports pagination via `page_size` query parameter (default: 100 results per request). Returns a 200 response with an array of DesignOutputSummary objects containing design metadata.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'List Designs' is too generic and doesn't distinguish this endpoint from ListPreBuiltDesign. Description lacks clarity about the response structure and return type. Added distinction between user designs and pre-built designs, clarified pagination behavior, and specified the response format (array of DesignOutputSummary objects) to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'DuplicateDesign' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs improvement: missing clarity about the required path parameter (design ID), the optional request body structure (DesignDuplicateInput), and the response format (201 with DesignOutput). Added specifics about naming behavior, independence of the duplicate, and response structure to help AI agents understand inputs and outputs.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to duplicate one of your existing designs**.

Modifying an existing design is often the easiest way to create something new.

You are not required to pass any data in the body of a request to this endpoint. If you choose to leave the `name` field blank, your duplicate will be assigned the name of the design it was copied from with the text "Duplicate: " prepended to it. This name change is only a convenience, as the duplicate will be assigned a unique ID that differentiates it from your other designs.

You can modify your duplicate's name at the time of creation by passing an updated value to the `name` field when making the initial request.
More on retrieving design IDs can be found below.
data.description_suggestion: Duplicates an existing design by ID and creates a new independent copy in your Design Library. Accepts optional DesignDuplicateInput with a custom `name` field; if omitted, the duplicate is named "Duplicate: [original name]". The duplicate receives a unique ID and can be modified independently from the original. Returns a 201 response with the new DesignOutput object containing the duplicated design's details.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs improvement: missing clarity about the required path parameter (design ID), the optional request body structure (DesignDuplicateInput), and the response format (201 with DesignOutput). Added specifics about naming behavior, independence of the duplicate, and response structure to help AI agents understand inputs and outputs.

message: Operation 'GetDesign' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and concise. Description lacks specificity about the required path parameter (design ID), the response structure (DesignOutput schema), and what fields are returned. Added clarity about the response format and expanded use cases beyond just pre-update retrieval to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single design**.

A GET request to `/designs/{id}` will retrieve details about a specific design in your Design Library.

This endpoint is valuable when retrieving information stored in a field that you wish to update using a PATCH request.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific design by its ID. Returns a 200 response with a DesignOutput object containing the design's complete metadata, HTML content, and editor information. Useful for retrieving current design state before making updates via PATCH request or for accessing design details needed for duplication or export.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and concise. Description lacks specificity about the required path parameter (design ID), the response structure (DesignOutput schema), and what fields are returned. Added clarity about the response format and expanded use cases beyond just pre-update retrieval to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'UpdateDesign' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description explains partial update behavior well but lacks specificity about which fields can be updated, the required path parameter (design ID), and the response format. Added clarity about updatable fields, the response structure (DesignOutput), and emphasized the partial update capability to help AI agents understand what can be modified and what is returned.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to edit a design**.

The Design API supports PATCH requests, which allow you to make partial updates to a single design. Passing data to a specific field will update only the data stored in that field; all other fields will be unaltered.

For example, updating a design's name requires that you make a PATCH request to this endpoint with data specified for the `name` field only.

```
{
    "name": "<Updated Name>"
}
```
data.description_suggestion: Performs a partial update to a specific design by ID using PATCH semantics. Accepts a request body with one or more updatable fields (e.g., `name`, `html`, `editor`). Only provided fields are modified; all other fields remain unchanged. Returns a 200 response with the updated DesignOutput object. Supports independent field updates without requiring the complete design object.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description explains partial update behavior well but lacks specificity about which fields can be updated, the required path parameter (design ID), and the response format. Added clarity about updatable fields, the response structure (DesignOutput), and emphasized the partial update capability to help AI agents understand what can be modified and what is returned.

message: Operation 'DeleteDesign' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and concise. Description warns about permanence but lacks specificity about the response (204 No Content), the required path parameter (design ID), and potential side effects or restrictions. Added clarity about the HTTP response code, emphasized irreversibility, and noted potential restrictions on designs in use to help AI agents understand the consequences of this destructive operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a single design**.

Be sure to check the ID of the design you intend to delete before making this request; deleting a design is a permanent action.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a specific design by ID from your Design Library. This action is irreversible and cannot be undone. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. Verify the design ID before executing this operation, as deleted designs cannot be recovered. Designs in use by active campaigns may have restrictions on deletion.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and concise. Description warns about permanence but lacks specificity about the response (204 No Content), the required path parameter (design ID), and potential side effects or restrictions. Added clarity about the HTTP response code, emphasized irreversibility, and noted potential restrictions on designs in use to help AI agents understand the consequences of this destructive operation.

message: Operation 'ListPreBuiltDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is verbose and not action-oriented. Description clearly distinguishes from user designs but lacks specificity about response structure and return type. Improved summary to be more concise and action-focused. Enhanced description to specify the response format (array of DesignOutputSummary objects), clarify pagination behavior, and emphasize the use case of discovering templates for duplication.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of pre-built designs provided by Twilio SendGrid**.

Unlike the `/designs` endpoint where *your* designs are stored, a GET request made to `designs/pre-builts` will retrieve a list of the pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs. This endpoint will not return the designs stored in your Design Library.

By default, you will receive 100 results per request; however, you can modify the number of results returned by passing an integer to the `page_size` query parameter.

This endpoint is useful for retrieving the IDs of Twilio SendGrid designs that you want to duplicate and modify.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve paginated list of pre-built designs
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of pre-built designs provided by Twilio SendGrid. Returns only Twilio SendGrid template designs, excluding user-created designs (use `/designs` for those). Supports pagination via `page_size` query parameter (default: 100 results per request). Returns a 200 response with an array of DesignOutputSummary objects. Useful for discovering and duplicating pre-built designs as starting points for custom designs.
data.reasoning: Original summary is verbose and not action-oriented. Description clearly distinguishes from user designs but lacks specificity about response structure and return type. Improved summary to be more concise and action-focused. Enhanced description to specify the response format (array of DesignOutputSummary objects), clarify pagination behavior, and emphasize the use case of discovering templates for duplication.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of pre-built designs provided by Twilio SendGrid. Returns only Twilio SendGrid template designs, excluding user-created designs (use `/designs` for those). Supports pagination via `page_size` query parameter (default: 100 results per request). Returns a 200 response with an array of DesignOutputSummary objects. Useful for discovering and duplicating pre-built designs as starting points for custom designs.
data.reasoning: Original summary is verbose and not action-oriented. Description lacks clarity about response structure and return type. Added concise, action-oriented summary, clarified the distinction from user designs, specified the response format (array of DesignOutputSummary objects), and emphasized the use case of discovering designs for duplication to improve AI agent interpretability.

Operation 'DuplicatePreBuiltDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary is generic and doesn't indicate the optional naming capability. Description is verbose and contains redundant information ('like duplicating existing designs'). Improved version clarifies the optional request body, automatic naming behavior, customization option, and explicitly states the return value (newly created design object) for better AI agent understanding of what this operation accomplishes and what to expect.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to duplicate one of the pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs**.

Like duplicating one of your existing designs, you are not required to pass any data in the body of a request to this endpoint. If you choose to leave the `name` field blank, your duplicate will be assigned the name of the design it was copied from with the text "Duplicate: " prepended to it. This name change is only a convenience, as the duplicate design will be assigned a unique ID that differentiates it from your other designs. You can retrieve the IDs for Twilio SendGrid pre-built designs using the "List SendGrid Pre-built Designs" endpoint.

You can modify your duplicate's name at the time of creation by passing an updated value to the `name` field when making the initial request.
More on retrieving design IDs can be found above.
data.summary_suggestion: Duplicate a pre-built design with optional name
data.description_suggestion: Creates a copy of a pre-built design from the Twilio SendGrid library. The request body is optional. If the `name` field is omitted, the duplicate will be automatically named with the original design name prefixed by "Duplicate: ". You can customize the duplicate's name by providing a `name` value in the request body. The duplicated design is assigned a unique ID and stored in your Design Library. Returns the newly created design object with its unique ID and specified or auto-generated name.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic and doesn't indicate the optional naming capability. Description is verbose and contains redundant information ('like duplicating existing designs'). Improved version clarifies the optional request body, automatic naming behavior, customization option, and explicitly states the return value (newly created design object) for better AI agent understanding of what this operation accomplishes and what to expect.

message: Operation 'GetPreBuiltDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary lacks specificity about the ID parameter requirement. Description is repetitive and vague about what 'details' are returned. Improved version specifies the ID parameter requirement, clarifies the return value structure (complete design object with metadata, editor type, content), and provides clearer context about the operation's role in the design workflow for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single pre-built design**.

A GET request to `/designs/pre-builts/{id}` will retrieve details about a specific pre-built design.

This endpoint is valuable when retrieving details about a pre-built design that you wish to duplicate and modify.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a pre-built design by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific pre-built design from the Twilio SendGrid library using its unique ID. Returns the complete design object including metadata, editor type, and design content. This operation is useful for reviewing pre-built design details before duplicating and customizing them for your campaigns.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks specificity about the ID parameter requirement. Description is repetitive and vague about what 'details' are returned. Improved version specifies the ID parameter requirement, clarifies the return value structure (complete design object with metadata, editor type, content), and provides clearer context about the operation's role in the design workflow for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ListDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'List Designs' is too generic and doesn't distinguish this endpoint from ListPreBuiltDesign. Description lacks clarity about the response structure and return type. Added distinction between user designs and pre-built designs, clarified pagination behavior, and specified the response format (array of DesignOutputSummary objects) to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of designs already stored in your Design Library**.

A GET request to `/designs` will return a list of your existing designs. This endpoint will not return the pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs. Pre-built designs can be retrieved using the `/designs/pre-builts` endpoint, which is detailed below.

By default, you will receive 100 results per request; however, you can modify the number of results returned by passing an integer to the `page_size` query parameter.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of designs stored in your Design Library. Returns only user-created designs, excluding pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs (use `/designs/pre-builts` for those). Supports pagination via `page_size` query parameter (default: 100 results per request). Returns a 200 response with an array of DesignOutputSummary objects containing design metadata.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'List Designs' is too generic and doesn't distinguish this endpoint from ListPreBuiltDesign. Description lacks clarity about the response structure and return type. Added distinction between user designs and pre-built designs, clarified pagination behavior, and specified the response format (array of DesignOutputSummary objects) to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'DuplicateDesign' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs improvement: missing clarity about the required path parameter (design ID), the optional request body structure (DesignDuplicateInput), and the response format (201 with DesignOutput). Added specifics about naming behavior, independence of the duplicate, and response structure to help AI agents understand inputs and outputs.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to duplicate one of your existing designs**.

Modifying an existing design is often the easiest way to create something new.

You are not required to pass any data in the body of a request to this endpoint. If you choose to leave the `name` field blank, your duplicate will be assigned the name of the design it was copied from with the text "Duplicate: " prepended to it. This name change is only a convenience, as the duplicate will be assigned a unique ID that differentiates it from your other designs.

You can modify your duplicate's name at the time of creation by passing an updated value to the `name` field when making the initial request.
More on retrieving design IDs can be found below.
data.description_suggestion: Duplicates an existing design by ID and creates a new independent copy in your Design Library. Accepts optional DesignDuplicateInput with a custom `name` field; if omitted, the duplicate is named "Duplicate: [original name]". The duplicate receives a unique ID and can be modified independently from the original. Returns a 201 response with the new DesignOutput object containing the duplicated design's details.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs improvement: missing clarity about the required path parameter (design ID), the optional request body structure (DesignDuplicateInput), and the response format (201 with DesignOutput). Added specifics about naming behavior, independence of the duplicate, and response structure to help AI agents understand inputs and outputs.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single design**.

A GET request to `/designs/{id}` will retrieve details about a specific design in your Design Library.

This endpoint is valuable when retrieving information stored in a field that you wish to update using a PATCH request.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific design by its ID. Returns a 200 response with a DesignOutput object containing the design's complete metadata, HTML content, and editor information. Useful for retrieving current design state before making updates via PATCH request or for accessing design details needed for duplication or export.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and concise. Description lacks specificity about the required path parameter (design ID), the response structure (DesignOutput schema), and what fields are returned. Added clarity about the response format and expanded use cases beyond just pre-update retrieval to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'UpdateDesign' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description explains partial update behavior well but lacks specificity about which fields can be updated, the required path parameter (design ID), and the response format. Added clarity about updatable fields, the response structure (DesignOutput), and emphasized the partial update capability to help AI agents understand what can be modified and what is returned.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to edit a design**.

The Design API supports PATCH requests, which allow you to make partial updates to a single design. Passing data to a specific field will update only the data stored in that field; all other fields will be unaltered.

For example, updating a design's name requires that you make a PATCH request to this endpoint with data specified for the `name` field only.

```
{
    "name": "<Updated Name>"
}
```
data.description_suggestion: Performs a partial update to a specific design by ID using PATCH semantics. Accepts a request body with one or more updatable fields (e.g., `name`, `html`, `editor`). Only provided fields are modified; all other fields remain unchanged. Returns a 200 response with the updated DesignOutput object. Supports independent field updates without requiring the complete design object.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description explains partial update behavior well but lacks specificity about which fields can be updated, the required path parameter (design ID), and the response format. Added clarity about updatable fields, the response structure (DesignOutput), and emphasized the partial update capability to help AI agents understand what can be modified and what is returned.

message: Operation 'DeleteDesign' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and concise. Description warns about permanence but lacks specificity about the response (204 No Content), the required path parameter (design ID), and potential side effects or restrictions. Added clarity about the HTTP response code, emphasized irreversibility, and noted potential restrictions on designs in use to help AI agents understand the consequences of this destructive operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a single design**.

Be sure to check the ID of the design you intend to delete before making this request; deleting a design is a permanent action.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a specific design by ID from your Design Library. This action is irreversible and cannot be undone. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. Verify the design ID before executing this operation, as deleted designs cannot be recovered. Designs in use by active campaigns may have restrictions on deletion.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and concise. Description warns about permanence but lacks specificity about the response (204 No Content), the required path parameter (design ID), and potential side effects or restrictions. Added clarity about the HTTP response code, emphasized irreversibility, and noted potential restrictions on designs in use to help AI agents understand the consequences of this destructive operation.

message: Operation 'ListPreBuiltDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is verbose and not action-oriented. Description clearly distinguishes from user designs but lacks specificity about response structure and return type. Improved summary to be more concise and action-focused. Enhanced description to specify the response format (array of DesignOutputSummary objects), clarify pagination behavior, and emphasize the use case of discovering templates for duplication.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of pre-built designs provided by Twilio SendGrid**.

Unlike the `/designs` endpoint where *your* designs are stored, a GET request made to `designs/pre-builts` will retrieve a list of the pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs. This endpoint will not return the designs stored in your Design Library.

By default, you will receive 100 results per request; however, you can modify the number of results returned by passing an integer to the `page_size` query parameter.

This endpoint is useful for retrieving the IDs of Twilio SendGrid designs that you want to duplicate and modify.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve paginated list of pre-built designs
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of pre-built designs provided by Twilio SendGrid. Returns only Twilio SendGrid template designs, excluding user-created designs (use `/designs` for those). Supports pagination via `page_size` query parameter (default: 100 results per request). Returns a 200 response with an array of DesignOutputSummary objects. Useful for discovering and duplicating pre-built designs as starting points for custom designs.
data.reasoning: Original summary is verbose and not action-oriented. Description clearly distinguishes from user designs but lacks specificity about response structure and return type. Improved summary to be more concise and action-focused. Enhanced description to specify the response format (array of DesignOutputSummary objects), clarify pagination behavior, and emphasize the use case of discovering templates for duplication.
